body_html:
once again sorry - i have found a way of getting fuse to behave the way I want, so I would like this change (or something similar to allow a bit of meta-data to be attached to a fusion instruction or the internal computation).

another idea - perhaps - is to allow the API to set the name of the internal instruction. I don't like using strings as a place to store enumerations, but it is an alternative.

yet another is to allow the API to set the name of the instruction itself - same problem with using a string as an enumeration.

once again sorry - i have found a way of getting fuse to behave the way I want,  so I would like this change (or something similar to allow a bit of meta-data to be attached to a fusion instruction or the internal computation).
another idea - perhaps - is to allow the API to set the name of the internal instruction.  I don't like using strings as a place to store enumerations, but it is an alternative.
yet another is to allow the API to set the name of the instruction itself - same problem with using a string as an enumeration.
body:
once again sorry - i have found a way of getting fuse to behave the way I want,  so I would like this change (or something similar to allow a bit of meta-data to be attached to a fusion instruction or the internal computation).

another idea - perhaps - is to allow the API to set the name of the internal instruction.  I don't like using strings as a place to store enumerations, but it is an alternative.

yet another is to allow the API to set the name of the instruction itself - same problem with using a string as an enumeration.
